answers.answer: The materials used in bonding can cause a bad taste to be present after treatment but I wouldn't have expected it to be for a prolonged period. The materials used act as a gluing agent so come with a bad taste.Without knowing the exact materials and whether it was veneer bonding or composite bonding it is hard to say.I would recommend going back to see you DentistDental Nurse

question: Several weeks ago, I had my front teeth professionally bonded; just the front upper front teeth. I started noticing a weird, chemical taste in my mouth soon after.I do not take any medications, (except multi-vitamins,calcium and fish oil pills.  I do not have diabetes nor any other diseases,  I am  healthy 62 year old female.I am having difficulty with my taste buds as well.  Immediately after a flavorful a"tasting" meal,the chemical taste in my mouth returns.  And while eating I can't really taste my food.  I have to sprinkle salt, on my food in order to "taste" what I am eating, an attempt to bring out the flavor of the food.  Something I rarely add salt to any meal.  I  have always followed a low sodium diet. Could the teeth bonding procedure have caused this?I do plan to bring this problem to my dentist attention in the next few days.
title: metal mouth
